text: osxphotos 0.69.2 OSXPh 9cs documentation otos Q ° What 15 OSXPhotos? e OSXPhotos provides both the ability to interact with and query Apple's Photos.app library on macOS directly from your python code as well as a very flexible command line interface (CLI) app for OSXPhotos Tutorial exporting photos. You can query the Photos library database — for example, file name, file path, and OSXPhotos Command Line metadata such as keywords/tags, persons/faces, aloums, etc. You can also easily export both the Interface (CLI) tojatellate1M=1ateM=tolie=te Melgle] () -Й OSXPhotos Template System OSXPhotos Python Package Supported operating systems verview OSXPhotos Python API Works on macOS and linux. Some features are compatible only with macOS. OSXPhotos Python Reference This package will read Photos databases for any supported version on any supported macOS version. E.g. you can read a database created with Photos 5.0 on MacOS 10.15 on a machine running macOS 10.12 and vice versa. Requires python >= 3.9. Installation The recommended way of installing osxphotos is with pipx. The easiest way to do this on a Mac is to use homebrew: e Open Terminal (search for Terminal in Spotlight ог look in Applications/Utilities ) e Install homebrew according to instructions at https://brew.sh/ e Type the following into Terminal: brew install pipx e Then type this: pipx install osxphotos e Now you should be able to run osxphotos by typing: osxphotos Command Line Usage This package will install а command line utility called osxphotos that allows you to query the Photos database and export photos. Usage: osxphotos [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
